revisions.rev:
'''[[Jackie Chan]]''' is a prolific singer, having started producing records in the early 80s. He started singing the theme songs over the [[closing credits]] of his films in 1980, when the film ''[[The Young Master]]'' was produced. Chan sang its theme song, titled "Kung Fu Fighting Man" entirely in English.{{cite web | title = Jackie Chan: Kung Fu Fighter Believes There's More to Him Than Meets the Eye | publisher = hkvpradio (Hong Kong Vintage Pop Radio) | url = http://www.hkvpradio.com/artists/jackiechan/ | accessdate = 2009-02-12 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080420123513/http://www.hkvpradio.com/artists/jackiechan/ |archivedate = 2008-04-20}}{{cite web | title = KungFu Fighting Man | publisher = Youtube | url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Db2y6dVpU4Q | accessdate = 2007-07-13 }} Since then he has produced over 20 different albums, singing over 100 songs in over five languages, and has teamed up with singers such as [[Ani DiFranco]] and the late [[Anita Mui]].{{cite web | title = HkpvRadio | work = Karlmaka | publisher = HkvpRadio(www.hkvpradio.com) | url = http://www.hkvpradio.com/artists/jackiechan/ | accessdate = 2007-07-13 }} His personal achievements also include winning Best Foreign Singer Award in Japan in 1984. ==Studio albums== {| class="wikitable" |- !
